remarks: The class ` S ` of finite approximations to the DC sequence is a set. (We derive here the stronger statement that ` S ` is a subset of a specific set, namely ` ~P ( _om X. A ) ` .)  (Unnecessary distinct variable restrictions were removed by David Abernethy, 18-Mar-2014.) (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 27-Jan-2013.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 18-Mar-2014.)
statement:
axdc3lem.1 $e |- A e. _V $.
axdc3lem.2 $e |- S = { s | E. n e. _om ( s : suc n --> A /\ ( s ` (/) ) = C /\ A. k e. n ( s ` suc k ) e. ( F ` ( s ` k ) ) ) } $.
axdc3lem $p |- S e. _V $.
$d A n s $.
